title: DOCTOR WHO: RECORDED TIME
author: Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 1
filename: 150 - Recorded Time and Other Stories - Catherine Harvey, Richard Dinnick, Matt Fitton, Philip Lawrence_djvu.txt

elements.text: COLIN BAKER Time traveller.
NICOLA BRYANT Time traveller’s companion.
The King — (45) — a fun-loving, womanising megalomaniac.
The Queen — (30S) — a beautiful, clever and much maligned wife.
The King’s scribe — a kindly, over-worked and loyal retainer, who is old before his time.
A servant — an enthusiastic but relentless chatterbox.
KEN BENTLEY
ALAN BARNES
DAVID RICHARDSON
NICHOLAS BRIGGS & JASON HAIGH-ELLERY
BIG FINISH PRODUCTIONS LTD © 2011
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 2
SCENE 1: INT. LIBRARY
FX: PEN SCRAPES ON VELLUM.

(V/O) The King’s enemies fell one by one. No adversary could resist his will. The world itself was in his grasp, to do with as he wished. But one was called across the void to stop the writing, the writing, the endless writing...
(CHANTING BESIDE) Rotcodsu evas, suo te moco. (REPEATS
(MUTTERING AS HE WRITES) ‘Come to us, you who are yourself without Time. Oh, come to us and save us — Doctor!’
FX: THEIR WORDS, JOINING WITH THE WINDS, SWELL TO A CRESCENDO
OPENING THEME
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 3
SCENE 2: EXT. RIVERBANK
FX: RIVER ATMOS. TARDIS MATERIALISES. DOOR OPENS
EXITING) England! I wasn’t expecting that. (FX: CLOSES DOOR
What year do you think it is?
That’s the question. (SNIFFING AIR) Certainly smells like the Sixteenth Century.
I think that could be the river. (RECOILING) Phew!
And that palace looks a recent conversion. Beautiful quarter- brick offsets in cross-bond with diaper patterning. (FX: CREAKING, OFF — A GATEHOUSE SLIDING ACROSS THE GROUND THROUGH: )
I’ve no idea what you said but I’m guessing it means old.
If I were a betting man, Peri, I'd hazard 1536.
Hold on, Doctor — did the gatehouse..? No.
Did the gatehouse what?
Out of the corner of my eye, I thought I saw... No, it’s nothing.
Really, Peri.
(FX: LOUDER CREAKING AND CRACKING OF STONE AS THE WHOLE PALACE SLIDES OVER GROUND. NOW WE HEAR A TUDOR FEAST IN PROGRESS, OFF: EATING, DRINKING, MERRIMENT, LUTE MUSIC)
There — it happened again! The whole palace moved closer to us.
That is.. strange. And look! A pathway has unfolded beneath our feet —
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 4
(NOTICING PATH) Oh yeah!
. I think we can take that as an invitation to follow it, don’t you?
FX: HENRY’S BOOMING LAUGHTER FROM NEARBY GREAT HALL
Sounds like a party.
It does. (DECISIVELY) Come on!
Wait! We can’t just stroll into the middle of the Great Hall and say hello.
(CALLING) Absolutely. We’1ll have a much better view from the Minstrels’ Gallery.
FX: THEY WALK. CROSS TO:
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 5
SCENE 3: INT. GREAT HALL/MINSTRELS’ GALLERY (FX: FEASTING ATMOS, LUTE MUSIC— AS IN PREVIOUS SCENE
(CALLS) More ale! This suckling pig brings on a mighty thirst. (TO ANNE, BESIDE) I fear, my Queen, that you are in the doldrums.
You are wrong, sire. I am as merry as a lamb.
FX: CROSS TO DOCTOR AND PERI, IN GALLERY ABOVE:
That’s Anne Boleyn, isn’t it?
It is indeed. Second wife of Henry the Eighth.
I did study British History at high school, you know.
(BELOW, LOUDLY) You are sullen, lady. Do not contradict your king.
FX: MUSIC STOPS, MERRIMENT QUIETENS AS ARGUMENT ESCALATES
(BELOW, LOUDLY) I am as you would have me.
She’s very beautiful.
One of the most beautiful women who ever lived.
(BELOW, LOUDLY) Who is your master, madam?
(BELOW, LOUDLY) Who is your current mistress, sir?
And moody too.
To be fair, she did have a great many rivals to contend with.
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 6
I can’t think why, the way he tears his food with his fingers and wipes the grease across his sleeve. Ugh!
FX: CROSS BACK DOWNSTAIRS:
These bursts of the humours bore me, madam.
Because I do not laugh, and blink at all transgressions?
What? Shrewish?
While every tavern wench who serves your ale smiles and hopes she may one day be Queen?
FX: CROSS BACK TO GALLERY:
She sure gives as good as she gets.
A firebrand. Look at those eyes, blazing.
BELOW, LOUDLY) Perhaps some music will appease you. (CALLS UP
Minstrel! Ho! You up there!
Maybe if we don’t reply he won’t notice us?
(CALLING FROM BELOW) You sir! Do you hear?
Too late for that, I’m afraid. (CALLS) Yes — your Majesty?
(BELOW, CALLING) More music!
(CALLING) I think the minstrels are... er...
(CALLING) On a break?
(TO PERI) A break?!?
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page
(BELOW, CALLING) Ah! Who is your fair companion?
(CALLING) I’m Peri... your Highness.
(BELOW, CALLING) Come down to us, Peri, that we may see you more clearly.
(ASIDE) What shall I do, Doctor?
(ASIDE) I think you’d better do as he says.
(BOOMS) Come to us! Now!
FX: CUT TO:
4: INT. LIBRARY [FLASHBACK]
FX: A QUICK ETHEREAL REPRISE FROM SCENE 1:
(CHANTING BESIDE) ‘Rotcodsu evas, suo te moco.’ (REPEATS
‘Come to us, you who are yourself without Time. Oh, come to us and save us — Doctor!’
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 8
SCENE 5: INT. GREAT HALL
(APPROACHING WITH PERI) Good day, your Majesty.
Good day to you, fool!
A fool? No, your Majesty. Quite the contrary, in fact.
Then why do you wear motley?
Motley?
(LAUGHS) I think he means your coat, Doctor.
I’1ll have you know, sire, that this will be the height of fashion in four hundred and fifty years’ time!
FX: RAUCOUS LAUGHTER FROM GUESTS
(LAUGHS) Anne! You have excelled yourself in bringing me such entertainment.
But I did not...
(CUTTING OVER) King Henry. I, sir, am the Doctor — and may I take the opportunity to say what an honour it is to meet one of the greatest minds of the age?
You may. But tell me, “Doctor” —
Yes, your Majesty?
Do you know any good bottom jokes?
I’m sorry?
Jokes pertaining to the bottom.
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 9
Oh, my!
(EYEING PERI) Your companion really is delightful! Is she part of your act?
You could say that.
(LAUGHS) What merry japes have you for me today?
I’m really not a...
(THREATENING) Do you cross me, fool?
No, no, your Majesty. The Doctor and I — we’re players. Strolling players.
Players?
Yeah, you know, strolling along. You have plenty of jokes — don’t you, Doctor?
Apparently I do.
Then, pretty Peri — (FX: PATTING HIS LAP) — sit upon my lap, and we will watch this fool of yours perform.
I’m not sure that would be appropriate.
(LAUGHS) It seems the only fool is you, Henry.
Silence! If you cannot enjoy your gift, pray do not poison it for me.
L ‘told ‘you; T-.did nots,
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 10
(CUTTING OVER, QUOTING) “I come no more to make you laugh...”
How’s this?
“.. Only they
That come to hear a merry bawdy play,
[..] or to see a fellow
In a long motley coat guarded with yellow, Will be deceived; for, gentle hearers, know —”
(WHISPERS) Doctor, what are you doing?
(WHISPERS) Shakespeare. Henry the Eighth, Peri. What could be more appropriate?
Why do you whisper? Is there offence in this?
No, no — I do but jest. No offence in the world,your Majesty. “.. think ye see
The very persons of our noble story
As they were living; think you see them great,
[..] then in a moment, see
How soon this mightiness meets misery —”
Enough! This is pure melancholy. Have you no earthy jokes?
Forgive me, your awesome presence has wiped the usual store of lavatorial humour from my mind.
(LAUGHS) Thank you — Doctor, did you say?
For what, my lady?
For making me laugh.
What’s this? Do you mock me, sir?
Not at all.
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 11
He’s joking — aren’t you, Doctor?
Ah, lovely Peri! I think ‘tis time to see you dance.
Dance!
Dance, I say! I am the King. I will not be ignored!
(ASIDE) I think you’re going to have to dance, Peri.
Sing, too, a song of love.
OK! OK! But I don’t really know any...
(BOOMS) Sing!
All right. (DECIDES) But don’t cut my head off if you don’t like it. Er.. (BEGINS, EMBARRASSED, TO SING AND ‘DANCE’ “GREENSLEEVES ’ )
“Alas, my love, you do me wrong,
To cast me off discourteously.
(UNDER BREATH) Oh, dear!
(SINGS) “For I have loved you well and long,
Delighting in your company.” (BEAT, UNCERTAIN) How’s that?
(RISING, CLAPPING) Splendid! Splendid!
FX: SYCOPHANTIC APPLAUSE, DIES DOWN QUICKLY
My dear, you sing as doth the lark herself. But I am unfamiliar
with the tune. What minstrel wrote it?
Actually, I thought you did.
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 12
(LAUGHS) Charming! Quite charming!
FX: SYCOPHANTIC LAUGHTER
The sort of charm cheap harlots provide.
Hey...!
I’m sorry we offend your Majesty.
You do me no offence, sir.
If you’re offended, Anne, then go. None here waits upon you for their pleasure.
I see that plain enough. For you, my husband, clearly seek your entertainment in another’s eyes.
FX: ANNE STORMS OUT
I fear my Queen grows pettish.
Don’t sweat it, we all get a little grouchy sometimes.
(LAUGHS) You are enchanting. What better gift to soothe her choleric humour?
I don’t understand?
Oh, I think I do.
You’11 make a comely lady in waiting.
Hold on a minute...
That’s not a very good idea.
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 13
You dare presume to school a mighty king!
Not at all, I was merely...
I am tired of your impertinence. Guards! Away with this Fool — to the stocks!
FX: CHEER FROM GUESTS
(GRABBED BY GUARDS) Your Majesty, I didn’t...
Silence! Or I shall have you whipped. Take him away!
FX: DOCTOR IS DRAGGED AWAY
(CALLING AFTER) Doctor!
And now, my dear, I think it time to fit you for the Queen’s bedchamber.
Oh, Lord!
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 14
SCENE 6: INT. LIBRARY
FX: PEN

(V/O) The King’s ambition grew out of all bounds. And, as his power increased, his palace flourished: buildings extended, gardens blossomed, towers rose towards the skies in apt reflection of his majesty.
(MUTTERS WHILE WRITING: ) Meanwhile his Queen, an exile to his will, sat alone and awaited her fate...
FX: CROSSFADE TO:
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL)
SCENE 7: INT. QUEEN’S BEDCHAMBER
FX: KNOCK. DOOR OPENS
What do you want?
(CARRYING CLOTHING) The King says sorry.
And I suppose he sends you as a gift. (SIGHS) Come in.
Page 15
(FX:
DOOR CLOSES. PERI APPROACHES THROUGH:) Where is your friend,
the Doctor?
In the stocks. I hope he’1l be OK.
He’s safe enough from Henry’s wrath for now.
The King said I’m to be your lady in waiting?
Did he.
(FX: SETTING CLOTHES ON BED) Here — these clothes are for you.
I think you’ll find they are for you.
For me?
I recognise that look in Henry’s eye, when a woman pleases it. And as I was once Queen Catherine’s lady, now you are mine.
Believe me, I don’t want to be Queen!
Everything King Henry fixes on King Henry takes, no matter what
the cost. It is written.
"Tt is written?”
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 16
Be careful. He will wipe away all who stand in his path. Your husband included.
My what?
The “Doctor”.
You don’t understand...
Your lover?
No, we're just.. friends. Travelling companions.
I wish you well with Henry then. Our marriage is a broken thing — I cannot put it right.
May I make a suggestion, my Lady?
Please do.
I think you shout too much.
I shout?
And leaving a room without conflict resolution isn’t doing your relationship any good. I mean, do you storm out a lot?
Girl, you forget yourself!
Look, I’m only trying to help.
Put on your borrowed costume, courtesan, and give the King exactly what he wants. We all do in the end. (FX: SHE STORMS OUT. DOOR SLAMS )
I guess that answers my question.
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 17
SCENE 8: EXT. COURTYARD
FX: SQUELCH — ROTTEN FRUIT HITTING DOCTOR/STOCKS
(LAUGHS) Splendid! Now, let us see if I can hit your nose.
I’d really rather you didn’t, if it’s all the same to...
FX: SQUELCH
Agh! .. you.
Nearly! (LAUGHS UPROARIOUSLY)
For someone with a reputation for the greatness of his intellect you really are a philistine.
(YAWNS) The hour grows late. And you begin to bore me.
You’11l forgive me if I’m not offended.
I bid you a good night in the stocks to contemplate what ‘tis to cross a King in love. (FX: EXITS)
(TO SELF) In love! Ridiculous! (BEAT) Now... (EFFORT, TWISTING AND WRIGGLING) .. how exactly does one get out of this device...?
FX: FOOTSTEPS APPROACHING FROM OFF — ANNE IN DISGUISE
Back so soon? What have you armed yourself with now? (FX: FOOTSTEPS FREEZE) Cabbages? (WITH EFFORT) I can’t turn my head, you know. (BEAT) Come out and face me like a man.
DISGUISING VOICE) Hush. (FX: WHISPERINGS SWELL, AS SCENE 1
(CHANTING BESIDE) “Rotcodsu evas, suo te moco...”
What’s that?
FX: WIND AND WHISPERINGS PICK UP UNDER:
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL)
(DISGUISING VOICE) “Rotcodsu evas, suo te moco...”
Who are you?
(DISGUISING VOICE, LOUDER) “Rotcodsu evas, suo te moco...” (LOUDER STILL) “Rotcodsu evas, suo te moco...”
FX: WOOD SPLINTERS
(FLEETING PAIN) Aaah!
Page
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 19
SCENE 9: INT. QUEEN’S BEDCHAMBER
FX: KNOCK
Come [in.]
FX: DOOR OPENS
(AT DOOR) Good day to you, my Lady.
I’m sorry — should I...?
(AS IF SHE SHOULD KNOW) I’m Marjorie.
Right. (FEELS SHE SHOULD KNOW WHO THIS IS) Sorry, should I know you?
I’m to be your maid, Madam. Is there anything I can do for you, at all?
Well, for openers I can’t breathe in this dress. And I’m waiting to be taken to a rampant Tudor royal who wants... (SHUDDERS) Eugh! I don’t even want to think about it.
Madam?
I mean, no — thank you.
In that case, the King requests your presence in his private apartments.
Yep — that’s what I was afraid of.
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL)
SCENE 10: EXT. COURTYARD
FX: WIND/VOICES SUBSIDING
Oh! My head! (WINCES) My fingers!
(DISGUISED VOICE) Hush.
What made the stocks disintegrate like that?
(DISGUISED VOICE) What matter? You are free.
Yes — thank you. I still don’t...
Page 20
(DISGUISED VOICE) Hush, Doctor. I will tell your fortune.
Normally I’d have no time for that sort of thing... but since you appear to have assisted my release, it’d be churlish to refuse.
Madam, forgive me -if you would lift your hood...?
(DISGUISED VOICE) Hush. Show me your hand. (SURVEYS HIS HAND) I see Time spread across your palm. Your lifeline is... (GASPS)
These breaks are inexplicable.
I thought they might be.
(DISGUISED VOICE) You have... died before?
Not exactly.
FX: WIND PICKS UP AGAIN
That sound again.
(SOFTLY) “Rotcodsu evas, suo te moco...”
(FX: HER WHISPER PICKED UP AS IF BY THE WIND, REPEATS
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 21
What is it?
(DISGUISED VOICE) It is Time, my Lord. Follow the sound to the Tower. There, you will find the answers you seek.
FX: FOOTSTEPS RETREATING
Wait! (STANDING, CALLING AFTER HER) Wait! (TO SELF) Oh well. (SNIFFS) Eurgh, this coat smells ghastly...!
FX: CROSSFADE FROM CONTINUED WHISPERINGS/WIND INTO:
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 22
SCENE 10: INT. LIBRARY
FX: WRITING
(V/O) As Henry watched his children dying one by one — the sons and daughters, born of Catherine and of Anne, the future kings and princes of his realm — he wanted more than anything an heir.
(SPOKEN WHILE WRITING) A healthy boy to carry on his blood and Lines:
FX: CROSS TO:
SCENE 11: INT. TOWER STAIRCASE
FX: THE SCRIVENER’S WORDS CONTINUE IN THE DISTANCE

(MUTTERED WHILE WRITING) [Now desperation swelled to anger, anger to more murderous thoughts. Amid the panic of his barrenness, he formed a plan to rid himself of she who cannot give him what he wants. The woman who had loved him, borne for him a little girl.. and later still, another child, who withered all before their tear-dimmed eyes and faded into dark obscurity. A child who now lay buried cold under the earth, the ashes of his love for Anne, once a fire that burned so hot inside his heart. ]
FX: OVER THIS:
(APPROACHING, CLIMBING STAIRS) [.. when the King sent me to you. And...] I’ll be by your side at all times from now on, my Lady —
(RESIGNEDLY) Great.

(CLIMBING STAIRS) .. so anything you want — day or night, it doesn’t matter — let me know. And any questions you might have about the ins and outs of the Palace — I won’t call it gossip, because I’m not one for idle chatter, [but...]
(STOPS) What’s that noise?
(STOPPED) Noise, my Lady?
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 23
Someone chanting, I think. Above us, at the top of the tower.
That’s the records being kept.
The records?
Yes. (BEAT) Here we are. The King’s apartments.
Shouldn’t there be — I don’t know, guards, or something?
(GIGGLES COYLY) The King’s dismissed them so the two of you can be alone. (FX: OPENS DOOR) In here, Madam.
(WALKING IN) Wow! Those are some candlesticks!
Take a full morning to clean them if you’re to see your face reflected (BEAT) Make yourself comfortable, my Lady. The King won’t be long.
Er, right. Thank you... Marjorie.
FX: DOOR SHUTS. FOOTSTEPS FADE
(TO SELF) The King’s bedchamber, huh? (FX: PATS BED) Amazing bed! (BEAT) Actually, I’d rather not think about the amazing [bed. ]
FX: AN ETHEREAL WHISPER: “ROTCODSU EVAS, SUO TE MOCO...”
(STARTS) Is someone there? (BEAT) Creepy.
FX: FOOTSTEPS APPROACHING FROM STAIRS
Oh, here comes the biggest creep of all. (HEAVING HEAVY CANDLESTICK) Wonder if it counts as treason if I hit him with a
candlestick?
FX: DOOR OPENS
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL)
Page 24
(WARCRY, SWINGING CANDLESTICK) Aaaaaaah!
Agh!
FX: CANDLESTICK FALLING
Doctor!
Peri! more concerned if I’m all right.
Sorry. I thought you were...
Obviously. You look lovely, by the way.
Thanks.
I was going to ask you if you’re all right, but now I’m
Green suits you. Actually, more clothes suit you.
Very funny. the Queen’s always in such a bad mood. something?
That’s probably my coat.
Oh, yeah. (LAUGHS)
(FX: ETHEREAL WHISPER: “ROTCODSU EVAS,
Ssh. (BEAT) That whispering again...!
I’d laugh — if only I could breathe.
It’s no wonder (SNIFFS) Can you smell
SUO TE MOCO...)
Maybe it’s the records Marjorie mentioned.
What records? And who’s ‘Marjorie’?
Come on! This way. (FX: THEY EXIT)
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 25
SCENE 13: INT. LIBRARY/STAIRCASE OUTSIDE
FX: PAGES TURN. PEN
(MUTTERING WHILE WRITING) Wars were ended, enemies o’erthrown at his most glorious behest. [There was but one ambition to achieve to make him greater yet...]
FX: CROSS TO BEHIND DOOR, ON STAIRCASE JUST OUTSIDE:
(RUSHING UP TO STOP) It’s in here, Doctor!
(JUST BEHIND, HUFFING UPSTAIRS) Peri, wait! We can’t just rush in willy-nilly.
FX: CROSS BACK TO:
(MUTTERING) But soon events took a much harsher turn. The King had fallen out of love with his fair Queen, and wished for change.
FX: DOOR BURSTS OPEN
Hello?
(PAUSES, SNIFFS, RESUMES MUTTERING/WRITING) But Anne Boleyn did not despair. She had a daughter...
(WALKING IN) Excuse me? Sir?
(MUTTERING/WRITING) .. a daughter... who would one day become the greatest Queen our land has known...
What’s he doing, Doctor?
I think he’s predicting the future.
(MUTTERING/WRITING) And strangers travelled here through time from realms beyond the sky...
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL)
Does he mean us?
I rather think he does.
(BREAKS OFF WRITING; ADMONISHES SELF) Sorry, sorry...
place. Must not... Must not lose my...
He looks awful.
Writing is a serious business, Peri.
Page 26
Lost my
(MUTTERING/WRITING) .. ‘through time from realms beyond the sky.’ (FX: PEN DOWN) There! (SIGHS) It is written. (
PERI) Good day to you, most welcome guests.
Good day.
Hi.
I am glad to find you here at last.
Are you indeed? That’s interesting.
I trust your journey was a safe one?
Circumlocutory, but generally acceptable.
Good. (LAUGHING) Otherwise my work would be in would never do.
What were you writing?
History, my dear. I am the Scrivener.
The Scrivener?
vain.
TO DOCTOR &
And that
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 27
I see.
I don’t.
I re-write History, my dear.
But...
Let me show you. Please — ask me for anything.
(CAUTIOUS) I really don’t think...
Perhaps... (WRITING) ‘A fine... silk.. scarf.’ (FX: PEN DOWN) It is
written.
(FX: QUICK BURST OF WIND, WHISPERS ECHOING HIS WORDS: SCARF
APPEARS )
Doctor, look!
Incredible.
Alas the colour clashes with your garb! (WRITING) ‘A fine scarf... of the greenest moss, from the deepest forest.’
FX: WIND/WHISPERING ECHO HIS SPEECH
Doctor! It’s changing colour!
(TO DOCTOR) Maybe something for yourself, sir?
No, thank you.
silk
Oh, but I insist. (WRITING) ‘A lady of beauty, and high birth...
with hair as black as ebony...’
FX: WIND/WHISPERS
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 28
Doctor, I don’t like this.
(WRITING) She will love you...
Stop.
And die for you...
(STEPPING FORWARD) No!
FX: PEN STOPS. BOOK CLOSES. SOUND ECHOES
Too late, Doctor. It is written.
PAUSE
I wish you hadn’t done that.
I’m afraid the pen takes on a life of its own sometimes.
(REACHING OUT) It’s beautiful.
(SHRINKING BACK) I wouldn’t touch if I were you, my dear.
Is it.. made of gold?
No - the primary flight feathers of a bird now long extinct —
.The Temporal Phoenix! Of course!
Oh, of course.

An immortal bird whose wings are said to beat the seconds of Time itself. This pen, Peri, is lost Philesian technology. They trapped the poor creature, making it fly forever in a time loop. (TO SCRIVENER) But I thought the Time Lords had destroyed all these devices. How did you come by it, ‘Scrivener’?
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 29
Legend tells it fell from a shooting star.
A spacecraft?
Possibly.
Prince Henry found it as a boy — and made my father write his princely brother dead, so that he could become King.
Truly, the pen is mightier than the sword...
My father passed his burden on to me when he in turn was dead.
Burden?
A burden indeed, Peri. If I’m right, the ink is made from Time drawn from the Scrivener.
Each piece of Time I write takes Time from me, each death a piece of life. Now I am as you see me now - crabbed and o’erwracked with age. (SADLY) It is written.
FX: FOOTSTEPS ON STAIRCASE OUTSIDE — ANNE’S
Someone’s coming! It must be the King!
Oh, no — I'd forgotten about him!
FX: DOOR OPENS
Hush.
Who are you?
(CROSSING TO ANNE) Ah, my hooded fortune-telling friend. Or should I say — (RAISING HER HOOD) my Lady?
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 30
You?
We have no time to waste. The King is on his way. Today he plans to write himself immortal.
Immortal? But that would play havoc with...
The pen has written your adventures in the past. It knows of you. That is why we called to you across the void.
I dictated, and the Scrivener wrote. Your name was whispered on the winds of Time: ‘O come to us and save us, Doctor!’
I thought the TARDIS was unusually insistent.
FX: FROM BELOW, HENRY CLIMBING STAIRS, SINGING
(OFF, COMPOSING WORDS) ‘Greensleeves... was all my joy Greensleeves was my delight,
[Greensleeves was my hmm hmm hmm]
The King!
We are all dead if he discovers you. My lady Peri -
What?
The King has taken a fancy to you, has he not?
I suppose he... (REALISATION) Oh no. Put that thought right out of your mind!
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 31
SCENE 14: INT. STAIRCASE
(SINGING, COMPOSING) ‘If you intend thus to disdain, It does the more hmm-hmm, hmmm-hmmm...’
FX: DOOR CLOSES ABOVE
(CALLS) Who’s there?
(WALKING DOWNSTAIRS) Only me, your Majesty.
Ah! ‘Tis my Lady Greensleeves.
(LAUGHS NERVOUSLY) What? Oh, you mean the dress! I... see what you did there. Very good.
In the words of our song, I shall preserve your beauty for posterity.
Gee, thanks.
(BEAT) But what are you doing all this way up in the Tower, my dear? (MENACING) Not trying to run away, I hope...?
RECORDED TIME by Catherine Harvey (FINAL) Page 32
